note.p: French anatomist and physiologist. Brought up in an ardent republican family according to the principles of Jean Jacques Rousseau. Anatomy demonstrator, Faculty of Medicine in Paris, 1811–13. Taught a private course on physiology from 1813, and practised medicine. Founded a journal devoted to experimental physiology in 1821. His public demonstrations of vivisection experiments on dogs during a trip to England in 1824 provoked an antivivisection campaign. Professor of medicine at the Collège de France, 1831–47.
